Description: Heavily restored North Ionian pottery oenochoe, all upper parts in plaster. Rays at base; two friezes of goats on body, that on shoulder to right facing left, that on belly right, heads reverted. Plain bands between frieze
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The vessel was presumably restored at the British Museum prior to being shipped to Boston. Chr. Kardara, Rodiaki Aggeiographia (1963) 181, fig.156.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 46, pl. XIII, no. 3)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 218, no. 53)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 115, pl. XXXV, no. 325)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.045)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.6225 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
